alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN ST. LOUIS AND NORTHWESTERN LAKE COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles south of Rainy Lake East, to 11 miles northwest of Burntside Lake, to 9 miles southeast of Cook, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness Near Trout Lake around 745 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Tower and Robinson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
